If you have an equation like <inline-math/> then you will be able to instantly multiply all terms by <inline-math/> to end up at <inline-math/>, or do the reverse. theory.intro: <par>An equation often consists of multiple terms. The equation <inline-math/> for instance has two terms on the left and one term on the right. When rewriting such an equation, a common thing to do is <term>multiply all terms</term> by a factor, or alternatively <term>divide all terms</term> by a factor. We take a look at how and why this works, as well as what short-cuts we can take while doing so.</par>
